# Source: https://fly.io/docs/machines/api/volumes-resource/

\*)\]:mx-auto \[body\_:where(&\>\*)\]:max-w-2xl \[body:not(.toc)\_:where(&\>\*)\]:lg:mx-\[calc(50%-min(50%,35rem))\] \[body\_:where(&\>\*)\]:lg:max-w-3xl min-w-0 relative\"\>

# Volumes 

You can use the Volumes resource to create and delete volumes. A Fly Volume is persistent storage for a Fly Machine. Learn more about [volumes](/docs/volumes/).

Endpoints

[[get] /v1/apps//volumes](#list-all-the-volumes-in-an-app) [[post] /v1/apps//volumes](#create-a-volume) [[get] /v1/apps//volumes/](#get-a-specific-volume) [[put] /v1/apps//volumes/](#update-a-volume) [[delete] /v1/apps//volumes/](#delete-a-volume-permanently) [[put] /v1/apps//volumes//extend](#extend-a-volume) [[get] /v1/apps//volumes//snapshots](#get-a-list-of-snapshots-for-a-volume) [[post] /v1/apps//volumes//snapshots](#create-an-on-demand-volume-snapshot-beta)

## [](#volume-properties)[Volume properties] 

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property                Type      Description
  ----------------------- --------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `auto_backup_enabled`   bool      Enable automatic daily snapshots. Default true.
  `attached_alloc_id`     string    n/a
  `attached_machine_id`   string    The ID of the Machine thatâ€™s attached to the volume.
  `block_size`            int       The size of each memory block in bytes.
  `blocks`                int       The total number of blocks in the volume.
  `blocks _avail`         int       The number of blocks available for data in the volume.
  `blocks_free`           int       The total number of blocks free for data and root user ops.
  `created_at`            string    The date and time the volume was created.
  `encrypted`             boolean   Whether the volume is encrypted. Default true.
  `fstype`                string    The file system type.
  `id`                    string    The volume ID.
  `name`                  string    The volume name.
  `region`                string    The region where the volume resides, or the target region for volume create.
  `size_gb`               int       The size of the volume in GB.
  `snapshot_retention`    int       The number of days to retain snapshots. Defaults to 5 when not set. Min 1, max 60.
  `state`                 string    The state of the volume.
  `zone`                  string    The hardware zone on which the volume resides.

## [](#list-all-the-volumes-in-an-app)[List all the volumes in an app] 

Given the name of a Fly App, get a list of all the volumes that belong to it.

<div>

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App to list volumes for.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

</div>

<div>

[GET][/v1/apps//volumes]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X GET \\
Â Â Â Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes"Â 
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
no body
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property   Type   Required   Description
  ---------- ------ ---------- -------------
  no body                      

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
[
    ,
    
]
```

</div>

## [](#create-a-volume)[Create a volume] 

Create a volume for a specific app according to the configuration provided in the request body.

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App to create a volume for.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

[POST][/v1/apps//volumes]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X POST \\
Â Â Â Â   -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â   "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes" \\
Â Â     -d ''
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
,
"encrypted": true,
"fstype": "string",
"machines_only": true,
"name": "string",
"region": "string",
"require_unique_zone": true,
"size_gb": 0,
"snapshot_id": "string",
"snapshot_retention": 0,
"source_volume_id": "string"
}
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property                Type      Required   Description
  ----------------------- --------- ---------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `auto_backup_enabled`   bool      no         Enable automatic daily snapshots. Default true.
  `compute`               object    no         An optional object defining the compute specifications for the expected Machine size and type that the volume will attach to.
  `encrypted`             boolean   no         Whether to encrypt the volume. Default true.
  `name`                  string    yes        The name for the new volume.
  `region`                string    no         The region where the volume will be created. Defaults to the Machineâ€™s region if attached. If not attached, defaults to the appâ€™s primary region.
  `size_gb`               int       no         The size of the volume in GB. Default 3.
  `snapshot_id`           string    no         The ID of the volume snapshot to use to create the new volume.
  `source_volume_id`      string    no         The ID of the source volume for the volume fork.
  `require_unique_zone`   boolean   no         If true, we will provision this volume on hardware that doesnâ€™t have another volume with the same name on it. The typical pattern is to create as many volumes as you need, all with the same name and `require_unique_zone: true`. This will keep your app available in case a host goes down. This flag can also cause volume creation to fail, in case we have used up all unique zones, in which case you probably want to set it to false. Default true.
  `snapshot_retention`    int       no         The number of days to retain snapshots. Defaults to 5 when not set. Min 1, max 60.

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

```

## [](#get-a-specific-volume)[Get a specific volume] 

Retrieve details about a specific volume by its ID within an app.

<div>

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App the volume belongs to.

    `volume_id` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The ID of the volume to get.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

</div>

<div>

[GET][/v1/apps//volumes/]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X GET \\
        Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
        Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes/vol_6r7ye90k98ynwk1r"Â 
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
no body
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property   Type   Required   Description
  ---------- ------ ---------- -------------
  no body                      

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

## [](#update-a-volume)[Update a volume] 

Update paratemeters on the volume.

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App to create a volume for.

    `volume_id` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The ID of the volume to get.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

[PUT][/v1/apps//volumes/]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X PUT \\
Â Â Â Â   -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â   "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes/vol_6r7ye90k98ynwk1r" \\
Â Â     -d ''
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
,
"encrypted": true,
"fstype": "string",
"machines_only": true,
"name": "string",
"region": "string",
"require_unique_zone": true,
"size_gb": 0,
"snapshot_id": "string",
"snapshot_retention": 10,
"source_volume_id": "string"
}
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property                Type   Required   Description
  ----------------------- ------ ---------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `auto_backup_enabled`   bool   no         Enable automatic daily snapshots. Default true.
  `snapshot_retention`    int    no         The number of days to retain snapshots. Defaults to 5 when not set. Min 1, max 60.

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

```

## [](#delete-a-volume-permanently)[Delete a volume permanently] 

Delete a volume. This action cannot be undone.

Given the name of a Fly App and the volume ID of a Fly volume, delete the volume.

<div>

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App the volume belongs to.

    `volume_id` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The ID of the volume to permanently delete.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

</div>

<div>

[DELETE][/v1/apps//volumes/]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X DELETE \\
Â Â Â Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes/vol_6r7ye90k98ynwk1r"Â 
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
no body
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property   Type   Required   Description
  ---------- ------ ---------- -------------
  no body                      

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

```

</div>

## [](#extend-a-volume)[Extend a volume] 

Given the name of a Fly App and a volume ID, you can make a volume bigger by extending it. You can extend (increase) a volumeâ€™s size, but you canâ€™t make a volume smaller.

<div>

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App the volume belongs to.

    `volume_id` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The ID of the volume to extend.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

</div>

<div>

[PUT][/v1/apps//volumes//extend]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X PUT \\
Â Â Â Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes/vol_6r7ye90k98ynwk1r/extend" \\
Â Â   -d ''
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property   Type      Required   Description
  ---------- --------- ---------- ------------------------------------
  size_gb    integer   yes        The size in GB to make the volume.

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
,
Â Â Â Â "needs_restart": false
}
```

</div>

If `needs_restart` is true, then your Machine needs to be restarted to make use of the added space.

## [](#get-a-list-of-snapshots-for-a-volume)[Get a list of snapshots for a volume] 

Given the name of a Fly app and a volume ID, list the available snapshots for that volume.

<div>

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App to list snapshots for.

    `volume_id` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The ID of the volume to list snapshots for.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

</div>

<div>

[GET][/v1/apps//volumes//snapshots]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X GET \\
Â Â Â Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes/vol_6r7ye90k98ynwk1r/snapshots" \\
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
no body
```

  Property   Type   Required   Description
  ---------- ------ ---------- -------------
  no body                      

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

Â Â Â Â ,
Â Â Â Â ,

## [](#create-a-volume-from-a-snapshot)[Create a volume from a snapshot] 

Create a new volume from a snapshot backup.

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App to create a volume for.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

[POST][/v1/apps//volumes]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X POST \\
Â Â Â Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes" \\
Â Â -d ''
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property        Type     Required   Description
  --------------- -------- ---------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `name`          string   yes        The name for the new volume.
  `region`        string   yes        The target region. Must be in the same region as the Machine you want to attach it to.
  `size_gb`       int      no         The size of the volume in GB. Default 3.
  `snapshot_id`   string   no         The ID of the volume snapshot to use to create the new volume.

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

```

If you wait a moment and then get the new volume, the state should be `â€œcreatedâ€?`.

## [](#create-an-on-demand-volume-snapshot-beta)[Create an on-demand volume snapshot (beta)] 

Create an on-demand volume snapshot.

<div>

Path parameters

:   

    `app_name` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The name of the Fly App to create a snapshot for.

    `volume_id` [: ] [string] [required]

    :   The ID of the volume to create a snapshot of.

```
<!-- -->
```

Responses

:   

    `200` [: ] []

    :   OK

</div>

<div>

[POST][/v1/apps//volumes//snapshots]cURLJSONTable

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
curl -i -X POST \\
Â Â Â Â -H "Authorization: Bearer $" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
Â Â Â Â "$/v1/apps/my-app-name/volumes/vol_6r7ye90k98ynwk1r/snapshots"
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
no body
```

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)[Wrap text]

  Property   Type   Required   Description
  ---------- ------ ---------- -------------
  no body                      

[Status: 200 OK â€" Example response]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight

    }
}
```

</div>

Wait a few moments for the snapshot to get created and then [get the list of snapshots](#get-a-list-of-snapshots-for-a-volume) to confirm.
